newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Colombia raises internal coffee price to new high.
newsitem.headline: Colombia raises internal coffee price to new high.

text.p: Colombia's National Coffee Growers' Federation raised the country's internal coffee price to a new all-time high of 431,375 pesos per 125-kg load Friday in the 14th such price hike since Jan 31, a federation spokesman said.

The new price was up 7.5 percent from from 401,250 pesos per 125-kg load set on May 16 and was based on an average trading price of $265.11 a lb of Colombian coffee in New York over the last week, the spokesman said.

The internal price has been cut only twice since Jan 31, when a new sliding-scale formula was introduced to calculate payments to Colombian growers and help the domestic price track the sharp run-up in world prices.

The internal price serves as little more than a benchmark, however, since the federation has been authorized to pay growers any price necessary to supply itself with fresh coffee amid the current supply squeeze.
